summary: These are Assistant U.S. Attorney preparation notes for a detective's trial testimony, recalling differences observed at Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence between a 2003 investigation and a 2005 search, including changes in decor and specific photographs present.

persons.name: AUSA Det.
persons.context: The detective whose recollections are being prepared for trial testimony, noting changes at Jeffrey Epstein's residence between 2003 and 2005.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'. His Palm Beach residence (358 El Brillo Way) is the subject of the detective's observations, and he is pictured in photographs described within the home.

connections.description: The detective investigated Epstein's Palm Beach property in 2003 and again during a 2005 search, observing changes in the residence.

events.title: Initial Investigation at Epstein Residence
events.description: A law enforcement investigation took place at 358 El Brillo Way, Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach home. The detective noted the office was neat and orderly.

events.title: Search of Epstein Residence
events.description: A search was conducted at 358 El Brillo Way. The detective observed the office was cluttered with fabric samples, indicating redecorating, and noted specific photographs present.

events.title: Trial Testimony Preparation
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney prepared notes for a detective's upcoming trial testimony, confirming travel and accommodation logistics would be covered by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Jeffrey Epstein's residence)
New York, NY (location for upcoming trial testimony)
keyFacts: The interior of Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach home changed between a 2003 investigation and a 2005 search, with the office becoming cluttered with fabric samples, suggesting redecorating activity.
Specific photographs were observed in the residence in both 2003 and 2005, including a photo of a little girl, a photo of Epstein with the Pope, and a photo of Epstein with Fidel Castro.
Some photographs seen in 2003 were not present during the 2005 search.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York arranged to pay for a detective's travel, hotel, and per diem for trial testimony in New York.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating restricted disclosure of certain information.
